oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vergleich der Adaptation von Winterweizenpopulationen mit unterschiedlichem Anbauhintergrund
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Weedon, Odette
Haak, Jette
Brumlop, Sarah
Finckh, Maria R.
Heinrich, Sven
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Biodiversity and ecosystem services
Breeding, genetics and propagation
Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thirteen winter wheat composite cross populations originating from one population but with differing histories over six years and three reference varieties were compared for yield, disease occurrence, as well as phenotypic diversity. The populations performed similarly and often better than the reference varieties in terms of yield and had lower incidence of disease. The populations are also phenotypically diverse and differ among each other, indicating that they have maintained a high degree of diversity over time and in varying locations, but most likely also diverged from each other.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Weedon, Odette; Haak, Jette; Brumlop, Sarah; Finckh, Maria R. and Heinrich, Sven (2014) Vergleich der Adaptation von Winterweizenpopulationen mit unterschiedlichem Anbauhintergrund. Poster at: 13. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Hochschule für nachhaltige Entwicklung Eberswalde, 17. - 20. März 2015.
